description: I installed in two desktops (home and office) both with an excellent hardware configuration running Debian Stretch. At first, in my office computer, the app worked properly (this was in 19/07/2016). But on the next day, I don't know what happened, it started to crash when I tried to configure the axis to log-log scale and change the export format to gnuplot. However, the worst is when the app doesn't crashes in these circumstances, because I continue to working, giving point to point in three different curves, digitizing each one, and saving... But when I export the data, the exported file is empty!!! So I decided to test it in my home computer, and the same is happening, and this time it crashed at the first attempt to use it. Does anyone know what's happening?
summary: The app is great... but it's crashing in Debian 9

description: I have been using this app on Windows for years and it's just great to see it working on Linux.
On my computer it works very well.

Juste parfaite pour mon utilisation. Simple et intuitive en plus.
Pour extraire de vielles datasheet de lampes (électronique) et les utiliser ensuite sur LibreOffice! Juste géniale!
使用很方便。之前在windows就用过。
